question: 思う
sourceAnswer: to{} think/consider/believe/reckon | think-(of-doing)/plan-(to-do) | judge/assess/regard | imagine/suppose/dream | expect/look-forward-to | feel/be-(in-a-state-of-mind)/desire/want | recall/remember
userAnswer: to{} think/reckon | judge/assess | imagine/suppose | plan-to  | expect ..
activeAnswer: to{} think/reckon | judge/assess | imagine/suppose | plan-to  | expect ..
userExplanation: the everyday variation of the word, not fancy or poetic etc
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>think</kanji> so the verb version is <vocabulary>to think</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned that reading with this kanji, but here's a reminder of the mnemonic just in case: 

You have to remember the <ja>おも</ja> part to read this word. To do this, though, you'll have <vocabulary>to think</vocabulary> about that guy... hmm... what was his name? He's on The Simpsons... he's the bartender? I think? <reading>Oh! Moe</reading> (<ja>おも</ja>) is his name! Thank you. Now I remember.

If you don't know Moe from the Simpsons use a different Moe, perhaps the one from the Three Stooges? You should be able to come up with one.
